diff_analysis.evidence: In paste/httpexceptions.py the OLD code used comment_quote (from paste.util.quoting) when rendering exception bodies into HTML and plain text. comment_quote only prevents breaking out of HTML comments, not general HTML injection, and its removal in favor of no_quote indicates the previous behavior was considered unsafe. Additionally, in paste/urlmap.py the OLD code HTML-escaped diagnostic text with cgi.escape before embedding it in an HTTPNotFound comment; the NEW code removes this escaping, implying the prior version mishandled or inconsistently escaped user-controlled data. Together these show the OLD code had improper neutralization of output that could be reflected into error pages, constituting an XSS risk.
